questions.question: What was a major feature of the pre-colonial era in Nigeria's commerce?
options: Indigenous trade practices and local/regional commerce.
Export of cash crops to Europe.
questions.explanation: The pre-colonial era in Nigeria was characterized by indigenous trade practices and local/regional commerce, with trade routes facilitating the exchange of goods.

questions.question: Which trade routes facilitated commerce in pre-colonial Nigeria?
questions.explanation: Pre-colonial Nigeria's trade was facilitated by the Trans-Saharan trade routes in the north and river-based trade routes in the south.
